explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds (olefin).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 71degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing fluorine, chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 71degC, Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 47mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of 790mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 0.8mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1991).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In rabbit eye irritation tests, mild irritation was found, with a Draize score of <=1 in all affected animals. The effects resolved within 48 hours (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1991)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea-pig skin sensitization studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1991)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of mutagenicity observed in any of the following studies: reverse mutation tests on bacteria, forward mutation tests on CHO cells, unscheduled DNA synthesis tests on primary cultured rat hepatocytes, chromosome aberration tests on CHO cells, and chromosome aberration tests on rat bone marrow cells in vivo (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1991)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1991)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction and offspring development in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1991).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In rat single dose toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including increased response to auditory stimuli, altered locomotor activity, lateral position, clonic convulsions and salivation were seen (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2001)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: In dog repeated dose toxicity studies, tremors were noticed (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1991)). The effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.11microg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2001).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=6 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.
